questions.question_text: What is the network virtualization platform used by a vSphere 6.x Software-Defined Data Center?
questions.answer_description:
VMware NSX is the network virtualization platform for the Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC).
Reference: http://www.vmware.com/products/nsx

questions.question_text: Which statement best defines the virtual machine hot-add feature?-

discussion.content: D. Administrators can increase the capabilities of a virtual machine without powering it off.

choices.C: Administrators can add and install applications without restarting it.
choices.D: Administrators can increase the capabilities of a virtual machine without powering it off.
choices.A: Administrators can transfer the virtual machines from one physical server to another while the virtual machine is running
choices.B: Administrators can copy-and-paste virtual machines instead of creating them from scratch.

choices.B: Manage virtual machines with simple and intuitive tools

questions.question_text: Which feature of vSphere 6.x enables organizations to move virtual machines across data centers?
questions.answer_description:
Sphere vMotion capabilities have been enhanced in this release, enabling users to perform live migration of virtual machines across virtual switches, vCenter Server systems, and long distances
Reference: http://www.vmware.com/files/pdf/vsphere/VMW-WP-vSPHR-Whats-New-6-0-PLTFRM.pdf
